question.text: The female mosquito is the vector for which of the following diseases?

solution.text:
Wuchereria - the filarial worm (W. bancrofti and W. malayi) - a helminth.

Disease: Elephantiasis or Filariasis

Mode of infection: By the bite of a female mosquito (vectors).

Life cycle: Entry of Wuchereria into the body of humans → A chronic inflammation develops slowly for many years usually in the lymphatic vessels of the lower limbs → Affected organs become swollen (filariasis or elephantiasis).

Sign and symptoms: Lower limbs and genital organs are usually involved, resulting in gross deformities.

Plasmodium (a protozoan) [Different species of Plasmodium-P. vivax, P. malaria, and P. falciparum]

Mode of infection: Bite of female Anopheles mosquito.

The infectious form of Plasmodium: Sporozoites.

Sign and symptoms: Chill and high fever recurring every 3 to 4 days.

Life cycle: Plasmodium requires two hosts to complete its life cycle - Human (host) and female Anopheles mosquito (vector).
